issue.title: Executing hx_connect() from standalone computer running MATLAB R2014b API causes MATLAB to crash

content.raw:
Carlos remotely controlled the machine and successfully installed v0.7.0. I installed the new SDK, v0.6.0, onto our standalone computer.

We are still experiencing crashing on every execution of hx_connect(), as was the case with Gazebo v0.6.5 and SDK v0.5.0. Again, running MATLAB R2014b as an administrator removes this crashing problem.

One thing for you to be aware of: the standalone computer we are using is very old, and its motherboard is RAM'd to the max just so it can run Windows 7. It has also been redesignated for different lab purposes over the years. The fact that you guys can't recreate the crash could be explained by our using an old, worn out computer to run MATLAB. We are going to move the VRE setup into a new location soon with a much better PC running the MATLAB API. I will let you know if this problem persists with better hardware.
